description: Information about the geographic, vertical, and temporal extent of a resource.

___verticalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a vertical boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

___description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the verticalExtent.

___crsId.description: Identifies the vertical coordinate reference system used for the minimum and maximum values.

___maxValue.description: Highest vertical extent contained in the resource.

___minValue.description: Lowest vertical extent contained in the resource.

___temporalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

___timeInstant.description: Represents an identifiable position in time.

$eref.description: A temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.
Describes the spatial area of the resource

_88boundingBox.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

___eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

___minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

___westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

___unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

___maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicDescription > geographicIdentifier > MD_Identifier > code

___description.description: Short description of the geographic areal domain of the data set. Examples include, "Manistee River watershed", "extent of 7 Â½ minute quads containing any property belonging to Yellowstone National Park", or "ponds and reservoirs larger than 2 acres in Jefferson County, Colorado".

___boundingBox.description: General geographic position of the resource.

___geographicElement.description: An array of objects each describing a geographic boundary or location comprising all or a portion of the resource.

___containsData.description: Idication of whether the geographic element encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data are not present.
